thread.title: Astros fans' excitement continues to rise
thread.title_full: Astros fans' excitement continues to rise

title: Astros fans' excitement continues to rise
text:
Show Transcript Hide Transcript 
A PERMISSION SLIP. THANKS A LOT. AND OF COURSE, YOU KNOW THE FANS ARE EXCITED ABOUT THIS ONE AS WELL. EVEN THOSE WHO DIDN'T GET TO GO THE GAME MAKE SURE THEY WERE WATCHING AND CELEBRATION. BILL SPENCER LIVE IN DOWNTOWN TONIGHT. AND FANS ARE PUMPED ABOUT THE PLAYOFFS, BILL. Reporter: SYAN, YOU HAD BETTER BELIEVE IT. IN FACT, THE ASTROS FANS ARE RIDING ADRENALINE HIGHS. [CHEERING] Reporter: HIGHER THAN I HAVE EVER SEEN. EASILY AS HIGH AS THAT BLASTING SHOT THAT COLBY RASMUS HIT INTO THE RAFTERS DURING THE GAME. TONIGHT ASTROS FANS ARE SIMPLY SAYING, THIS IS OUR YEAR. [CHEERING] Reporter: YOU CAN CALL IT JUBILATION, YOU CAN CALL IT MANIA. CALL IT PLAYOFF FEVER. WHATEVER IT IS, HOUSTON'S GOT IT AND WE'RE FEELING IT IN A BIG WAY. ECSTASY! ELATION. GOOD, MAN, I'M JUST FEELING IT, IT'S LIKE, THIS CROWD IS SO ENERGETIC. IT'S UNBELIEVABLE. WE'RE GOING TO KEEP ON GOING AND WIN THE WORLD SERIES! WE'RE GOING THE WORLD SERIES. ESPN HAS PREDICTED IT. YOU GUYS HAVE PREDICTED IT. YOU GOT NOTHING BUT GREAT YOUNG PLAYERS HERE THAT ARE FULL OF ENERGY. RASMUS WITH A HIGH DRIVE INTO RIGHT. THAT ACTUALLY HITS THE ROOF! Reporter: OH, YEAH. DURING TODAY'S EXCITING GAME, YOU HAD PLENTY OF FAN FAVORITE MOMENTS AND FAVORITE PLAYERS. WHEN RASMUS HIT THE TOP OF THE ROOF AND GOT A RALLY STARTED. THE CY YOUNG TODAY. CYCLE ONE THE CY YOUNG TODAY. SEVEN INNINGS, ONE RUN, CY YOUNG TODAY. [CHEERING] Reporter: NOW AHEAD IN THIS SERIES AND LOOKING STRONG, WHAT'S NEXT FOR THIS CINDERELLA TEAM? 10 YEARS REMOVED FROM ITS LAST APPEARANCE IN THE PLAYOFFS. NOW THE ROYALS ARE DEAD! BRING ON THE RANGERS. THEY'RE DEAD! BRING ON THE -- THE CARDINALS, THE CUBS, THEY'RE DEAD! THIS IS OUR CITY! THIS IS OUR YEAR! Reporter: YEAH, YOU CAN TELL THEY'RE SERVING RED BULL HERE TONIGHT. AND LET ME TELL YOU, TOMORROW IF YOU IS THIS COME DOWN WITH A CASE OF ORANGE FEVER, THEY'RE OPENING HERE AT LUCKY'S PUB AT 10:00 A.M. THEY'RE GOING TO HAVE THE BACK DECK OPEN. THEY'LL HAVE THE JUMBOTRON GOING. WHAT DO YOU SAY, GUYS? [CHEERING] Reporter: GO 'STROS! BILL SPENCER, REPORTING LIVE IN HOUSTON. KPRC CHANNEL 2 NEWS, BACK TO YOU. AND SERVING MORE THAN RED BULL. THAT'S RIGHT. THANKS A LOT. TODAY'S BIG GAME STARTED OFF WITH SOME PRESIDENTIAL STAR POWER. FORMER PRESIDENT GEORGE H.W. BUSH HAD THE HONOR OF DELIVERING THE FIRST PITCH TO JED LOWRY WITH HIS LIFE BARBARA CLOSE BY. GAME FOUR OF THIS SERIES WILL BE PLAYED TOMORROW AFTERNOON OVER AT MINUTE MAID PARK. THINGS GET UNDERWAY AT 12:07. IF THE ASTROS DON'T CLINCH TOMORROW, WHICH IS NOT GOING TO BE THE CASE, GAME 5 WILL HEAD BACK TO KANSAS CITY AND BE PLAYED WEDNESDAY NIGHT AT 7:07. HOUSTON - 
You can call it jubilation, call it mania, call it a good case of orange crush fever -- whatever it is, Houston has it bad and Astros fans are feeling it in a big way, especially after Sunday’s win against the Kansas City Royals. 
“I feel ecstasy, elation, ah, shucks man, I’m just feeling it. This crowd is so energetic it’s unbelievable," Astros fan Charles Cusack said Sunday after the game. 
Christa McGee could barely contain her excitement as she walked out of Minute Maid Park, saying, “The crowd was amazing. We’re going to keep on going and win the World Series. D h!” Quick Clicks
